title: Just out of curiosity, about the Champion Mastery Ranking system...
body: Does it grade you on just purely stats? Or like, does it SOMEHOW take in your in game decision making and gameplay...

replies.body: The grading is based on your performance against the global (or regional) average for that champion.
Wow, there must be some really bad Ahri's around then... lol
To my knowledge it was said that it's also based around your skill level.
I get S's quite often with Ahri but the other day I got one from a not-so-good game and it just got me quite curious
Hand us a link to the poor S?
The main factor is win/lose. you can get S+ and lose and get 250 points and you can get C- and win and get 1000+ points
Sorry! I specifically wanted to know about the "letter" rankings
ahh ok my bad, im afraid im not sure

As far as I'm aware it looks at all the basic stats like gold, kills/deaths/assists, level etc. What I'm not sure of is whether it takes into account the deeper stats like dmg dealt, damage taken, healing done etc. 

As for decision making and gameplay, it's possible it uses a modified version of the system used to determine your mmr after each game which would make it much more sophisticated than just looking at stats.

The only other detail I know about the system is that S+ is designed to be (do correct me if I'm wrong) the top 2% of players with that champion in that role.

That's all I know. I'd certainly like some more information on what it uses, my curiosity can't help it :3
